title: Client participants: Baseline measures
description: Measures collected before the start of the study for client participants. As many of these measures are collected at 'baseline' it is currently called 'baseline.' However, this is a slight misnomer as, for example, current_study_status is dynamically updated.

custom.jcoin:missingValuesDescription:
**Below are extended descriptions of each `missingValues` (ie reserve code):**

  - Don't know: This code indicates that the respondent did not have the knowledge or information required to answer the question.
  - Refused: This code signifies that the respondent actively chose not to answer the question, despite being capable of providing a response.
  - Left blank: This code indicates that the question was intentionally left unanswered by the respondent.
  - Legitimately skipped: This code is used when the question was intentionally skipped due to its inapplicability or irrelevance to the respondent's situation.
  - Not collected: This code indicates that the data for the question was not collected or recorded by the survey administrator or interviewer.
  - Missing in error: This code signifies that the data for the question is missing without any clear reason or explanation.

fields.name: jdc_person_id
fields.title: JCOIN data commons person identifier
fields.description: The generated unique identifier specific to the JCOIN Data Commons for a given individual (client or staff).

fields.name: age
fields.title: Age
fields.description: About how old are you? (top coded at 90)

fields.name: sex_at_birth
fields.title: Sex at birth
fields.description: What sex was originally listed on your birth certificate?

fields.name: gender_id
fields.title: Gender Identity
fields.description: What is your gender identity?

enum: Genderqueer/gender nonconforming/neither exclusively male nor female

custom.jcoin:notes:
For gender/orientation/identity, use items O1-O2 if possible, otherwise use D4a-D4c.   [Must use one or the other.]
 False if not 'Male' and not 'Transfgender' else True

fields.name: gender_id_condensed
fields.title: Gender Identity (condensed)
fields.description: What is your gender identity?

custom.jcoin:notes: For gender/orientation/identity, use items O1-O2 if possible, otherwise use D4a-D4c.   [Must use one or the other.]

fields.description: [White] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.description: [Black or African American] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.description: [American Indian or Alaska Native] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.description: [Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.title: Race: American indian principal tribe or community specified
fields.description: [American indian principal tribe or community specified] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: hispanic_latino
fields.title: Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish Origin
fields.description: Are you of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin?

fields.name: race
fields.title: Race
fields.description:
Racial category derived from the individual racial category fields.
  - Exactly one racial category field selected = title of racial category
  - Two or more selected = Multiracial

enum: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

fields.name: sex_orient_category
fields.title: Sexual orientation
fields.description: Sexual orientation:  Do you think of yourself as...

fields.name: sex_orient_other
fields.title: Sexual orientation:  Other specified
fields.description: Sexual orientation:  Do you think of yourself as...

fields.name: ever_pregnant
fields.title: Ever pregnant
fields.description: Have you ever been pregnant?

enum: Previously pregnant, did not have a child

custom.jcoin:notes: Does this just apply to that past 90 days?  If not, then the participant should be able to check more than one response.

fields.name: marital_status
fields.title: Marital status
fields.description: What is your marital status?

fields.name: living_as_married
fields.title: Married with partner
fields.description: Are you currently living as married with a romantic partner?

enum: Yes, I am living as married with partner
No, I am not living as married with partner

fields.name: educ_category
fields.title: Education
fields.description: What is the highest grade or level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?

enum: Some college credit but less than 1 year of college credit
1 or more years of college credit but no degree
Graduate degree (e.g., MSW, MA, MS, JD, MD, DSW, EdD, PhD)

fields.name: educ_highest_grade
fields.title: Education:  Highest grade level (if less than GED or h.s. diploma)
fields.description: What is the highest grade completed?

fields.name: educ_other_specified
fields.title: Education: Other specified
fields.description: What is the highest grade or level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?

fields.name: intv_while_incarc
fields.title: Interviewed during incarceration
fields.description:
Interview conducted with participant during incarceration? 
If `No`, all fields in MOUD section involving prior to incarceration (PTI) should be `Legitimately skipped`

fields.name: days_incarcerated_interval
fields.title: Days incarcerated (in past 30/xx days)
fields.description: During the past xx/30 days, how many days have you been incarcerated?

fields.name: ever_rx_moud
fields.title: Medication ever prescribed for opioid use disorder?
fields.description:
Have you ever been prescribed and taken medication to treat opioid
use disorder?  (Illicit use should be excluded.) 
If `No`, then all drug-related MOUD section questions should be `Legitimately skipped`
